words.definition: To admonish someone is to tell them you disapprove of their behavior.
words.example: The teacher admonished Mark because he was chewing gum in class.

words.definition: If something is audible, then it is able to be heard.
words.example: The sound of the drums was audible from miles away.

words.definition: If something or someone is awesome, they are impressive or frightening.
words.example: The huge military plane was an awesome sight.

words.definition: To beware means to be careful of something or someone that is dangerous.
words.example: You should beware of the dog.

words.definition: To brag means to talk of one's abilities or achievements in a proud way.
words.example: He had to brag about his new car.

words.definition: If someone is conscious of something, they are aware of it.
words.example: The boy was conscious of his appearance.

words.definition: To disagree with someone means to have a different opinion from them.
words.example: The two friends disagreed about where to eat.

words.definition: To echo means that a sound repeats itself because it bounced off an object.
words.example: The sound of his voice echoed in the cave.

words.definition: Eventual means happening at the end of a series of events.
words.example: His eventual goal was to become a doctor.

words.definition: A hint is information that suggests something without saying it directly.
words.example: He gave me a hint about my birthday present.

words.definition: An idiot is a person who is not very smart.
words.example: Only an idiot would believe that story.

words.definition: If something is immense, it is very large.
words.example: The castle was immense.

words.definition: If something is indirect, it is not the shortest or easiest way.
words.example: He took an indirect route to the store.

words.definition: An option is a choice between two or more things.
words.example: I had the option of going to the party or staying home.

words.definition: A pastime is an activity that you do in your free time.
words.example: His favorite pastime is playing chess.

words.definition: If something is perfect, it is as good as it can possibly be.
words.example: The weather was perfect for a picnic.

words.definition: To pinpoint something means to find exactly where it is.
words.example: The pilot was able to pinpoint the location of the crash.

words.definition: To switch means to change something to something else.
words.example: I switched my major from history to English.

words.definition: If something is thorough, it is complete in every way.
words.example: The police did a thorough search of the house.

words.definition: To torment someone means to cause them severe mental or physical suffering.
words.example: The bully tormented the younger boy.
